🌟 Streams in the Desert - March 25 🌟

"But without faith it is impossible to please him: for he that cometh to God must believe that he is, and that he is a rewarder of them that diligently seek him." (Hebrews 11:6) 🙏

We all need faith for desperate days. The Bible is full of them—its stories, songs, prophecies, and revelations come from these hard times. These desperate moments are like stepping-stones to God’s light. They are His opportunity and our school of wisdom. 📖✨

Psalm 107 tells of God’s love and deliverance—every time people reached their "wit’s end," that’s when God’s power began. 💪🔥

Think about:

  • 🌌 God promising Abraham countless descendants, even when he and Sarah were as good as dead.
  • 🌊 The Red Sea parting and the Jordan River stopping—miracles in impossible moments.
  • 🙏 The desperate prayers of Asa, Jehoshaphat, and Hezekiah when they had no way out.
  • 📜 The faith of Nehemiah, Daniel, Hosea, and Habakkuk in their darkest hours.
  • ✝️ Jesus in Gethsemane, facing the cross, saying, "Nevertheless, not My will, but Yours."

Desperation is better than despair. Faith doesn’t cause hard times—it sustains and solves them. The only other option is despair, but faith holds on and wins. 🏆

🔥 Heroes of Desperate Faith 🔥

Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego showed unshakable faith:
"Our God can save us from the fiery furnace… but if not, we still won’t worship false gods!" (Daniel 3:17-18) 🦁🔥

And Jesus in Gethsemane prayed,
"If it’s possible… nevertheless, Your will be done." (Matthew 26:39) ✝️

Even in darkness, faith says "NEVERTHELESS!" 🌑➡️✨

Now, sing your favorite hymn of faith—and remember:

When obstacles and trials seem
Like prison walls to be,
I do the little I can do
And leave the rest to Thee.

And when there seems no chance, no change,
From grief can set me free,
Hope finds its strength in helplessness,
And calmly waits for Thee. 🎶❤️

—Rev. S. Chadwick ✍️
